title: Webinar for Educational Leadership
description:
Become the leader our schools need   If you’ve thought about the next step in your education career - whether that means becoming a principal, stepping into an admin role, or just making a bigger impact - we want to meet you.  Our Educational Leadership program is built for professionals like you who want to lead with purpose, create change, and shape the future of schools and students. We're hosting a  Webinar for Educational Leadership July 1 at 4:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Educational Leadership (MA)   Online, Fast Track, Core Choice, and Offsite 
 Supervisor Certification 
 Principal Certification 
 Director of School Counseling Services Certification

title: Getting Started with EndNote
description:
Using a citation manager like EndNote to organize your references has numerous advantages, including but not limited to... 
 
 Collect references as you browse the web or databases 
 Organize, highlight, and annotate your PDFs, all in one place 
 Sync between your devices 
 Automatically rename PDF files you've downloaded 
 Generate citations instantly and change style formats with a few clicks 
 
 This is an interactive workshop, and will not be recorded. By the end of this workshop, you will be able to import your existing references into the program, collect references from the library databases, and be able to generate citations using the "Cite While You Write" plugin. 
 If you can, please download the EndNote installation files in advance from the  Software Repository . 
 
 Related LibGuide:  EndNote by Siobhan McCarthy 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14788520

title: Kayaking on the Delaware River
description:
Enjoy a relaxing day paddling down the Delaware River and learn some basic kayaking skills. Leaving from Frenchtown, NJ, this full-day trip will provide you with a chance to enjoy the warm, clear waters of the longest undammed river east of the Mississippi. We provide the boats, life jackets and paddles, but be prepared to get wet. 
   How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration Opens on  6/23 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Rec Center main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10; Faculty/Staff $20 
 
 Where and When? 
 
 July 7, 2025 
 9:00 am - 6:00 pm  
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, bathing suit, towel, sunblock and a change of clothes. 
   
 Potential Hazards:  under/above water obstructions, rapidly moving water, poisonous plants/allergies, insect bites, unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration

title: Graduate Counseling Certificates Virtual Information Session
description:
Looking to expand your expertise and open new career opportunities in counseling? Our career-focused certificate programs can help you grow professionally and make a greater impact in the field of mental health and wellness.  Our academic preparation follows guidelines established by state licensure and certification boards, ensuring you have the most up-to-date training to perform on the job. During our  upcoming virtual information session on July 15 at 12:00 PM , you will learn about the following certificates we offer: 
 
 
 
   
 
 
 The courses in the  Certified Alcohol and Drug Counselor (CADC) Certificate  program fulfill the educational requirements set by the Addiction Professionals Certification Board of New Jersey (APCBNJ) for CADC eligibility.   
 
 
 The  Student Assistance Coordinator  program offers students the opportunity to take a sequence of post-master’s courses required by the New Jersey Department of Education for individuals who wish to become Student Assistance Coordinators in K-12 schools. 
 
 
 The  School Counselor (Post-Master’s Certification)  program meets the highest professional standards according to the New Jersey Department of Education and the national accrediting body, CACREP. This certification will provide the additional credit hours necessary to obtain a NJ School Counselor Certification.   
 
 
 The  Advanced Counseling Certificate  program is designed to fulfill state-level and national standards for Licensed Professional Counselors. This program meets the highest professional standards according to CACREP, The National Board for Certified Counselors (NBCC), and the NJ Board of Marriage and Family Therapists.

title: Higher Education MA Virtual Information Session
description:
Become a leader in Higher Education   
 Whether you're already working in higher ed or looking to break into the field, our flexible program is designed to meet you where you are - and help you go even further. 
 We're hosting a  virtual information session on July 15  at 6:00 PM . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. 
 Our coursework offers a broad focus on administration and leadership, preparing students for a variety of roles in higher education. The curriculum integrates organizational and social science perspectives and explores key administrative and programmatic issues.

title: Strategic Communications & Media (MA) Virtual Information Session
description:
Build a Career Where Strategy Meets Influence    
 The communication landscape is evolving—and skilled professionals who understand how to shape messages, manage platforms, and drive engagement are more valuable than ever. 
 Our  MA in Strategic Communication & Media  is designed to help you grow into leadership roles where strategy, creativity, and influence converge. 
 Join us for a Virtual Information Session: 
 
 Tuesday, July 15 at 7:00 PM (EST) 
 
 This is your opportunity to meet faculty, ask questions, and discover how our program can align with your goals—on your schedule, with your priorities in mind. 
 What You’ll Learn About: 
 ✔️ How to earn your degree in as little as 12 months ✔️ Our fully online, flexible course structure ✔️ Micro-credentials you can add along the way ✔️ The optional Industry Bootcamp that connects you with real-world opportunities ✔️ Career paths in PR, brand strategy, media relations, and digital communication

title: Environmental Science and Management (PhD) Virtual Information Session
description:
Build a Career at the Intersection of Science, Policy, and Environmental Impact 
 If you're ready to lead change on a global scale, our  PhD in Environmental Science and Management  can help you get there. 
 Designed for future researchers, policy experts, sustainability officers, and academic leaders, our program combines rigorous scientific training with real-world applications. You'll work alongside seasoned faculty and regional partners on research that addresses today’s most pressing environmental challenges—from climate resilience to water quality and ecosystem restoration. 
 Registration is LIVE for our Environmental Science and Management PhD virtual information session July 17 at 1:00 PM (EST) . Our PhD graduates are equipped to take on high-impact roles in: 
 
 Environmental policy and planning 
 Government and regulatory agencies 
 Sustainable business and corporate ESG leadership 
 Academic and nonprofit research 
 Consulting and environmental advocacy

 9:00 am - 5:00 pm

title: Gathering Your Sources
description:
Gathering resources for a research project can seem like a challenge: there are so many variables to consider. This workshop will look at the criteria that should guide your selection of sources.  But it will largely be a tutorial on database searching – for both scholarly articles and books. Moreover, we will look at the relationship between selecting sources and refining a research topic.  I hope you can join us.

title: Social Research and Data Analysis, Data Collection and Management Certificate, Customer & User Experience Certificate Virtual Information Session
description:
Where Research Meets Real-World Impact 
 If you're drawn to understanding people and using research to guide better decisions, Montclair’s graduate programs can help you turn that instinct into a powerful career path.  
 Why Montclair? 
 
 30-credit MA in  Social Research & Data Analysis  you can finish in just 16 months 
 The chance to stack your degree with fully online certificates in  Customer Experience and User Experience Research   and  Data Collection and Management 
 Real-world tools like R, SPSS, NVivo, and Qualtrics—plus support through mentorship, job leads, and career coaching 
 Paths to roles in UX, market research, education, public policy, and beyond 
 
 Registration is LIVE for our webinar July 29 at 6:00 PM (EST)   to get an inside look at programs that bridge human insight with data-driven decision-making.

description:
Start where you are, we'll help you build the rest     
 Our  Strategic Communication & Media   students gain preparation to step into roles that matter leading teams, shaping policy, transforming communities, and solving real-world challenges across industries. Whether you're looking to advance in your current field or pivot into something new, you'll find a path here that aligns with your goals. 
 Tune into an upcoming virtual information session: 
 
 Wednesday, July 30 at 7:00 PM (EST) 
 
 What makes Montclair different?   
 
 You can complete our program in as little as 12 months 
 Flexible, non-sequential course structure so you can start in any semester 
 Optional hybrid Industry Bootcamp 
 Micro-credentials while earning degree for immediate skill application 
 No GRE required 
 
 A  graduate program at Montclair isn’t just about leveling up your education—it’s about expanding what’s possible for your future. Our programs are built with your career in mind, connecting you to the tools, faculty, and experiences that help you make your next move with confidence.

title: Accounting (MS) Virtual Information Session
description:
Achieve More With An Accounting MS Our  Accounting (MS)  program is packed with hands-on learning, case studies, and real-world projects. You won’t just learn accounting theory—you’ll know how to use it to tackle real challenges in the field. We’ll help you check all the boxes to be CPA-ready, with courses designed to meet certification requirements.   
 Accounting Virtual Information Session Join us for a brief 30-minute meeting July 31 at 1:00 PM (EST) Virtual via Zoom ➡️  Register Now  to receive session link! 
 Program Snapshot: 
 
 Rolling admission 
 Fall and Spring start 
 Classes on-campus and online 
 Full and part time options 
 Evening and weekend classes 
 33 credits 
 14:1 Student to faculty ratio 
 
 Join our session to learn how the program can help you develop strong knowledge of accounting principles and essential business practices to advance your career.

Visiting the Pantry: 
 Please have your Event Pass, CWID and have a  PantrySoft Registration .  
 Our Mission:   We aim to address food insecurity across Montclair State University. The Red Hawk Pantry is open to all students, staff, and faculty at no cost. If you are unable to visit during our regular hours, please reach out via email at redhawkpantry@montclair.edu Stay updated by following us on Instagram: @montclair_redhawkpantry 
 Summer 2025 Hours- 
 
 Tuesdays: 12-2pm 
 Thursdays: 1-3pm

title: Minute To Win It Games
description:
Think fast, play hard, and win big! Join us at the Recreation Center Lounge for *Minute to Win It* — a high-energy event where every second counts. Each challenge you conquer earns you a chance to win raffle entries for the **grand prize: a brand-new MacBook Air**! 💻 Don’t miss your shot — the grand prize winner will be announced during **Rec Fest on 9/4**. Come for a chance to win big! 
   
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 August 25, 2025 
 2:30-4:30 p.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Lounge

title: Tye Dye Tuesday
description:
Join us for a splash of color and creativity at Tye Dye Tuesday! Stop by to design your very own tie-dye t-shirt—supplies are on us! We’ll be providing white shirts printed with our Advocacy and Outreach logo, so you can take home a one-of-a-kind piece that represents your style and your campus community. 
 🗓️ Date: August 26th, 2025 🕒 Time: 3PM - 5PM 📍 Location: Student Center Ballroom A 
 Whether you're here to chill, create, or connect, this is a great chance to express yourself and meet others in a fun, relaxed environment. No experience needed—just bring your energy! 
 Free shirts, free fun, and a whole lot of color. Don’t miss it!

title: Canvas Painting
description:
Tap into your wild side at Canvas Paint Night, where creativity knows no rules. Inspired by the bold, abstract brilliance of Pablo Picasso, this night is all about experimenting, expressing, and making art your own. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Tuesday, August 26 
 7pm-9pm, must be checked in by 8:30pm to participate 
 Student Recreation Center Lounge

title: Yoga Glow
description:
Join us for Glow in the Dark Yoga or Pilates! A unique, low-pressure class where movement meets mood lighting, black lights, and glowing vibes. This class is all about helping you reconnect, de-stress, and unwind from the pressures of a new semester in a calm, inviting space. It’s time to pause, recharge, and do something that feels good for your body and your mind💆‍♀️💆‍♂️ Come solo or with roommates, it's the perfect social way to stay active while doing something different. 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and when?

 Student Recreation Center Gymnasium

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: Pride and Progress: Celebrating LGBTQ+ and Disability Journeys
description:
Join Advocacy and Outreach for our 2nd Annual LGBTQ+ and Disability History and Awareness Month Flag Raising and Reception — a joyful celebration of identity, resilience, and community! 
 Pride and Progress brings together students, faculty, and staff to honor the rich histories and vibrant futures of LGBTQ+ and disability communities. Enjoy an inspiring flag-raising ceremony featuring an energetic MC, powerful speakers, and a special live performance you won’t want to miss. 
 After the ceremony, the celebration continues with: - Music & vibes - Delicious food - A hands-on craft activity - A photo activation station - Free LGBTQ+ and Disability Pride flags - Interactive tabling from campus partners 
 This event is about visibility, solidarity, and celebration — open to everyone, including allies! Come as you are, bring your friends, and help us raise our voices (and our flags!) in honor of progress, pride, and community power.

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.
